Key Match Events: West Indies squandered a high-octane half-century opening stand to crash to an 11-run defeat to Australia in the opening Twenty20 International of the three-match series.
Brandon King lashed 53 off 37 and his opening partner Johnson Charles scored a pulsating 42 off 25 deliveries.
David Warner top-scored with 70 off 36 deliveries in his 100th T20 International.
Warner and Josh Inglis had a 93-run opening stand.
Tim David counter-punched with a 17-ball unbeaten 37.
Andre Russell grabbed three wickets for 43 runs.
West Indies galloped to 74 without loss off the first power-play.
Marcus Stoinis took 2 wickets for 20 runs.
Adam Zampa ripped through the middle order with 3 wickets for 26 runs.
Jason Holder scored 34 off 18 balls in a 44-run, unbroken ninth wicket partnership with Akeal Hosein.
Post-Match Reflections: Captain Rovman Powell commented, 'In the middle we struggled to get a partnership but it was still a good game of cricket. We’ve just got to back ourselves a little bit more.'
